title: Swansea City fans print vile Emiliano Sala boarding passes ahead of derby with Cardiff
text:
Swansea City have condemned the 'disgraceful' actions of some fans after they printed vile boarding passes that mocked the death of Emiliano Sala.

Ahead of Swansea's derby against fierce rivals Cardiff City on Sunday at the Liberty Stadium, a disturbing image circulated on social media of a fake boarding pass with Sala's name on.

Nantes is the departure city name with Cardiff the destination - while the captain is Mikey Dye, a Bluebirds fan who was tragically killed at an England vs Wales clash back in 2011.

Swansea fans printed vile boarding passes mocking Emiliano Sala's death on Friday

The pass also features a flight number of 'D3AD', while Swansea City Airlines is emblazoned at the top alongside the club's crest.

It is not yet known who created the vile boarding pass but Swansea were quick to condemn the actions.

In an official statement, the Championship club said: 'Swansea City is aware of the disgraceful image currently circulating on social media ahead of Sunday's South Wales derby in relation to the sad death of Cardiff City striker Emiliano Sala.

'We are working closely with South Wales Police who will be conducting an investigation to identify the initial source.

The Argentine forward tragically died in a plane crash on his way from Nantes to Cardiff

'The image is shameful and does not represent this football club or our supporters in any way.

'We have a zero-tolerance policy towards any discriminatory, unacceptable or anti-social behaviour, and this will be enforced rigorously before, during and after Sunday's South Wales derby.

'Any supporters displaying this type of material or behaving in an unacceptable manner will face criminal proceedings.

'The club will be strongly supporting South Wales Police in any public order or hate crime prosecutions surrounding these images and any related incidents during Sunday's fixture at the Liberty Stadium.'
description: Swansea City have condemned the 'disgraceful' actions of some of their own fans after they printed vile boarding passes that mocked the death of Emiliano Sala.
